intro: Stelis santiagoensis, commonly known as the Santiago orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant typically grows on rock surfaces or tree trunks, showcasing its epiphytic nature. Its leaves are narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps in water retention in its arid habitat. Stelis santiagoensis is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
